t: Proverbs 1
The*p proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
To*p know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
To*p receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
To*p give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
A*p wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
To*p understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
My*p son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
For*p they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
My*p son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
If*p they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
Let*p us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
We*p shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
Cast*p in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
My*p son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
For*p their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
Surely*p in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
And*p they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
So*p are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
Wisdom*p crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
She*p crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
How*p long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
Turn*p you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
Because*p I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
But*p ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
I*p also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
When*p your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
Then*p shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
For*p that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:*s
They*p would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
Therefore*p shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
For*p the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
But*p whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
Proverbs 2
My*p son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
So*p that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
Yea,*p if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
If*p thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
Then*p shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord,*s and find the knowledge of God.
For*p the Lord*s giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
He*p layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
He*p keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
Then*p shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
When*p wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
Discretion*p shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
To*p deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
Who*p leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
Who*p rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
Whose*p ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
To*p deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
Which*p forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
For*p her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
None*p that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
That*p thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
For*p the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
But*p the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
Proverbs 3
My*p son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
For*p length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
Let*p not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
So*p shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Trust*p in the Lord*s with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
In*p all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
Be*p not wise in thine own eyes: fear the Lord,*s and depart from evil.
It*p shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
Honour*p the Lord*s with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
So*p shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
My*p son, despise not the chastening of the Lord;*s neither be weary of his correction:
For*p whom the Lord*s loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
Happy*p is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
For*p the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
She*p is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
Length*p of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
Her*p ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
She*p is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.
The*p Lord*s by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
By*p his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
My*p son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
So*p shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
Then*p shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
When*p thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Be*p not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
For*p the Lord*s shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
Withhold*p not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
Say*p not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
Devise*p not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
Strive*p not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
Envy*p thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
For*p the froward is abomination to the Lord:*s but his secret is with the righteous.
The*p curse of the Lord*s is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
Surely*p he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
The*p wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
Proverbs 4
Hear,*p ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
For*p I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
For*p I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
He*p taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
Get*p wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
Forsake*p her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
Wisdom*p is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
Exalt*p her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
She*p shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
Hear,*p O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
I*p have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
When*p thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
Take*p fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
Enter*p not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
Avoid*p it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
For*p they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
For*p they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
But*p the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
The*p way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
My*p son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
Let*p them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
For*p they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
Keep*p thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
Put*p away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
Let*p thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
Ponder*p the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
Turn*p not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
Proverbs 5
My*p son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
That*p thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
For*p the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
But*p her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.
Her*p feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
Lest*p thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
Hear*p me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
Remove*p thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
Lest*p thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
Lest*p strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
And*p thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
And*p say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
And*p have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
I*p was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
Drink*p waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
Let*p thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
Let*p them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.
Let*p thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
Let*p her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
And*p why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
For*p the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord,*s and he pondereth all his goings.
His*p own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
He*p shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
Proverbs 6
My*p son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
Thou*p art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
Do*p this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
Give*p not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
Deliver*p thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Go*p to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
Which*p having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
Provideth*p her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
How*p long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
Yet*p a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
So*p shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
A*p naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
He*p winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
Frowardness*p is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
Therefore*p shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
These*p six things doth the Lord*s hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
A*p proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
An*p heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
A*p false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
My*p son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
Bind*p them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
When*p thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
For*p the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
To*p keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
Lust*p not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
For*p by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
Can*p a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
Can*p one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
So*p he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
Men*p do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
But*p if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
But*p whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
A*p wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
For*p jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
He*p will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
Proverbs 7
My*p son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
Keep*p my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
Bind*p them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
Say*p unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
That*p they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
For*p at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
And*p beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
Passing*p through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
In*p the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
And,*p behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
(She*p is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
Now*p is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
So*p she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
I*p have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
Therefore*p came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
I*p have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
I*p have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Come,*p let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
For*p the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
He*p hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
With*p her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
He*p goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
Till*p a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
Hearken*p unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Let*p not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
For*p she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
Her*p house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
Proverbs 8
Doth*p not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?
She*p standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.
She*p crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
Unto*p you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.
O*p ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
Hear;*p for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
For*p my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
All*p the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
They*p are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
Receive*p my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
For*p wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
I*p wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
Counsel*p is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
By*p me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
By*p me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
I*p love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
Riches*p and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.
My*p fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
I*p lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:
That*p I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.
The*p Lord*s possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
I*p was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
When*p there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
Before*p the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:
While*p as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
When*p he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
When*p he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:
When*p he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
Then*p I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
Rejoicing*p in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
Now*p therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
Hear*p instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
Blessed*p is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
For*p whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the Lord.*s
But*p he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
Proverbs 9
Wisdom*p hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
She*p hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
She*p hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
Whoso*p is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Come,*p eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
Forsake*p the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
He*p that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
Reprove*p not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
Give*p instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
For*p by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
If*p thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
A*p foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
For*p she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
To*p call passengers who go right on their ways:
Whoso*p is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Stolen*p waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
But*p he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
Proverbs 10
The*p proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
Treasures*p of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
The*p Lord*s will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
He*p becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
He*p that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
Blessings*p are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
The*p memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
The*p wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
He*p that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
He*p that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
The*p mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Hatred*p stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
In*p the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
Wise*p men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
The*p rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
The*p labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
He*p is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
He*p that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
In*p the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
The*p tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
The*p lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
The*p blessing of the Lord,*s it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
It*p is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
The*p fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
As*p the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
As*p vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
The*p fear of the Lord*s prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
The*p hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
The*p way of the Lord*s is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
The*p righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
The*p mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
The*p lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
Proverbs 11
A*p false balance is abomination to the Lord:*s but a just weight is his delight.
When*p pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
The*p integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
Riches*p profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
The*p righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
The*p righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
When*p a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
The*p righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
An*p hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
When*p it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
By*p the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
He*p that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
A*p talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
Where*p no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
He*p that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
A*p gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
The*p merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
The*p wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
As*p righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
They*p that are of a froward heart are abomination to the Lord:*s but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
Though*p hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
As*p a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
The*p desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
There*p is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
The*p liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
He*p that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
He*p that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
He*p that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
He*p that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
The*p fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
Behold,*p the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
Proverbs 12
Whoso*p loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
A*p good man obtaineth favour of the Lord:*s but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
A*p man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
A*p virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
The*p thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
The*p words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The*p wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
A*p man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
He*p that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
A*p righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
He*p that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
The*p wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
